intro: Exostema caribaeum, commonly known as the Caribbean nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The plant is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks.
